ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: which of you is afflicted with madness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: which of you has been afflicted by insanity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: - That who among you was insane.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Which of you is afflicted with madness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Which of you is afflicted with madness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: which of you is the demented.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Which of you is the demented.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: which of you is a prey to madness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Which of you is afflicted with madness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: which one of you is crazy.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Which of you is afflicted with madness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Which of you is afflicted with madness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: which of you is the demented.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Which of you is the afflicted.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:6] which of you is demented (al-maftūn is a verbal noun, similar [in expressional form] to al-ma‘qūl, ‘intelligible’; al-futūn meaning al-junūn, ‘insanity’) in other words, is it [this insanity] in you or in them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Which of you is the demented) which of you is mad. 682
